result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Crawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); All applicable fees of supervision.
*No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
*If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Provide a DNA sample.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
*Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
*Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
*Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: *Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 11/13/2015 by 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick D Crawley

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Vernon C.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS with 71 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time with Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 11/13/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form
Letter in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 09/19/2015 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the defense, and without objection from the State or Court, case is scheduled for projected guilty plea 09/10/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.
From Defense; supplemental brief on Motion to Suppress Evidence. Received and filed.

Case calendared for a jury trial. State wishes to bring forth an expert witness and requests an adjournment of the trial. GRANTED.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties here on continuation of hearing on Defense's Motion to Suppress from 7/2/15. Court orders sequestration of witnesses. Sworn for the state: Det. Joel Streicher. Exhibit 1 (previously received) played in court, as it was not reviewed on the previous motion date. Sworn for the defense: Derrick D. Crawley, Sr. Parties rest. Closing arguments made. Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court  finds that there was probable cause for the search and seizure therefore they were legal.  Therefore, the court DENIED defense motion to suppress.  

  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State's supplemental brief. Received and filed.

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on defense Motion to Suppress.
Sworn for the State: Deputy Jamie Arnold, Deputy Larrel Lirette. Exhibit #1 received. Case calendared for continuation of Motion Hearing on 7/15/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

and Defendant's Requested Jury Instruction received and filed. sab

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a final pretrial date and a jury trial date is granted by the court.  Scheduling order signed and filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 15  Jury trial scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Dennis Murphy for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute Sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick D Crawley in court with attorney Michael J Steinle. David A Feiss  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/15 @ 1:30 pm
